title: Rent in Lagos is Wild
notes:
CONTENT PILLAR-
(Emergency Rent Realities edition/Product Features X User benefits)

CONTENT FORMAT
Short-form video (60–90 seconds) for Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn.

Start with a popular Lagos rent protest clip, then cut to a direct-to-camera talking head. (Omotayo)

SCRIPT STRUCTURE
Opening Hook - Bold and daring statement about Lagos in relation to rent.
Example - Cost of rent is the loudest pain of living in Lagos.



Amplify the problem of rent.
Example- You’re forced to choose between affordability,
Landlords want two years upfront. Agents don’t care if your bank account cries. And you? You just want a decent place without killing your cash flow.

Body (Clarifying What ULE Is & What We Do)
Example- That’s why we built ULE Homes. To fix this exact problem.

“ULE is rent financing designed for people who earn but don’t want to drown under 2 years’ rent demands.”

Here’s what we do:

We pay your rent upfront,
You pay us back monthly—structured, realistic, and cash-flow-friendly.

title: 3 rent Mistakes Business owners make
notes:
Already Done, just Create Captions!

. 
SLIDE 1: TOPIC - 3 rent mistakes you may be making as a Business owner.


SLIDE 2

In Bold Texts - Frequently Dipping into Your Business Expansion Funds
In smaller texts - If every time you set money aside to buy new equipment, move to a better space, or grow your team, rent shows up and shakes the progress you planned for, you might be stuck in a costly mistake.

SLIDE 3
In Bold Texts - Frequently Rescheduling Key Expenses
In smaller texts- If you keep pushing back staff salaries or pausing your restock just to squeeze rent into the budget, you’re making a rent mistake that slows your entire business down.

SLIDE 4 
In Bold Texts - Frequently Misjudging Income Timing 
In smaller Texts - If you're always stuck, scrambling, or begging for a rent extension because an expected client payment didn’t come through , you’re living in a rent payment trap.


SLIDE 5
ULE Homes offers rent financing that provides structure to your rent payment so your business flow is not disrupted.

SLIDE 6 - CTA
We pay your rent directly to your landlord, and you pay us back in steady, monthly installments.
Send a DM with “Business Owner” and we’ll walk you through the sign up process.

LINKEDIN: 

Content Goal:To Convert problem-aware audience who are skeptical of paying rent monthly through ULE Homes due to the 2.9% interest, and believe saving is a better alternative.

Target Audience:

Nigerians aged 25–50
Working in Tech, Content Creation, or 9–5 jobs
Earning monthly or irregular income
Already aware of the rent problem but believe saving is safer than paying monthly with interest.

Funnel Stage:

Middle of Funnel (MOFU)

Content Pillar:Emergency Rent Realities, how real-life events disrupt rent savings and delay moving out or living independently.

Content Format:Carousel 

Content Tone:Realistic, understanding, and conversational
Not salesy. Focus on showing the reality of life, not just pitching the product.

Key Message:

"Saving towards rent is admirable — but life rarely lets you save in peace. Monthly rent lets you live without waiting for perfect conditions.

REFERENCE: SAVING FOR RENT
You save for 6 months, then dip into it to upgrade your tech workspace. Now you're back to square one.

PAYING MONTHLY
You pay your rent monthly and still upgrade your workspace in the same month.


CTA:
Need flexible rent that matches your life?
Send us a DM let’s talk options that won’t drain you.


Caption (Empathetic, not overly promotional):

You’re not lazy.
You’re just trying to be responsible with your money.
But real life isn’t linear,
One tech upgrade, a sudden health issue, or family emergency and that rent savings is gone.
We’ve seen it happen to a lot of people trying their best.
Sometimes peace of mind costs a 2.9% monthly interest that’s better than the chaos of restarting your rent plan every few months without completing it.

title: 5 types of Renters:
notes:
1. The Squatter
You're always living with someone, if you had a choice, you would move out, but every time you plan to, something unexpected happens that forces you postpone your plan.

2.The Failed Planner
You start each month with a solid plan to save for rent. But then, a trip to Zanzibar here, Dorime at Quilox there and a little skincare restock. Before you know it, your rent savings have been diverted to fund your soft life.

3. The Miracle Worker
Two weeks before rent is due, your bank account is empty. Yet, somehow, money appears just in time to cover the payment. You never quite understand how it happens it just does.

4.The Oga have mercy gang
You’re probably a freelancer, tech creative or business owner, is not that you will not pay o,
It is that your money is always processing when rent is due, so you have to beg the landlord to give you small time.

title: Rent renewal notification just dropped, what’s your reaction?
notes:
ACTION:Find Video memes that matches each expression and add the link in attachment box.


1. Tears because there is always one bill or the other to pay, since them born you, you never rest.

2.Unbothered, Nothing concerns you, odogwu will handle it.🤭

3.  Jesus 10X, cause how did house rent go from 2M to 5M just because landlord changed your bathroom tap and painted the gate days ago?

4. Calculator mode activated, energy,as the 500k in your account must cover rent, grocery shopping,and your monthly beauty maintenance.


5. Call your mummy immediately. You maybe 28, but you are still the baby of the house.


6. Rent Notification? Not your problem but a time to celebrate the decision you made to allow ULE Homes pay your bill rent for you, while you pay them in monthly bits.

title: If rent was a person, how will you describe it?
notes:
ACTION: Find meme videos that fits each of these situations.

If rent was a person, how will you describe it?

- The uninvited guest.
Always coming at odd hours, especially when business is slow or salary is delayed.

- Very egoistic, it’s never considerate of your situation and will not reduce for any reason.

- A weapon of wealth generation for House agents and Landlords. Cause how do you explain 850k for Agent fee on house rent already running in millions?


- The school bully 
Shows up every term to collect their cut, if you don't comply you’re punished with eviction.

- The Toxic ex.
It drains you emotionally and suffocates you financially but somehow, you keep going back every year.
